name: Pair
description: The Pair class is a generic utility class in JSMacros that represents a pair of values. It provides a simple way to store and manage two related values together as a single object.
overview:
The Pair class is a generic container that holds two values of potentially different types:
- Type-safe storage for two values using Java generics
- Simple getter and setter methods for both values
- Useful for returning multiple values from methods
- Commonly used for key-value associations
- Lightweight and efficient for temporary data storage

The class has two variants with different field naming conventions:
- **Core version** (t, u): General-purpose pair storage
- **BuildSrc version** (key, value): Optimized for map-like key-value operations

constructors.description: Creates a new Pair with the specified first and second values.

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: The first value to store in the pair

parameters.name: second
parameters.description: The second value to store in the pair

methods.name: getFirst
methods.description: Returns the first value stored in the pair.

methods.name: getSecond
methods.description: Returns the second value stored in the pair.

methods.name: setFirst
methods.description: Sets the first value of the pair.

methods.name: setSecond
methods.description: Sets the second value of the pair.

methods.name: getT
methods.description: Returns the first value using the generic type name. (Alternative to getFirst())

methods.name: getU
methods.description: Returns the second value using the generic type name. (Alternative to getSecond())

methods.name: setT
methods.description: Sets the first value using the generic type name. (Alternative to setFirst())

methods.name: setU
methods.description: Sets the second value using the generic type name. (Alternative to setSecond())
